**Notes:**
* The Chiana is a river in Tuscany, Italy, known for its slow-moving waters. * The speaker is comparing the difficulty of describing the divine to the difficulty of describing something that is far beyond our experience, such as the movement of the heavens.

**Esperanto:**

**Notes:**
* The speaker is describing a scene in which a group of saints are singing and dancing in Paradise. * The saints are so happy and carefree that they seem to be blessing themselves from one moment to the next. * The word "misura" in line 28 can also be translated as "dance."

**English:**

**Esperanto:**
31 Tiam la silenton en la harmoniaj diaĵoj 32 poste rompis la lumo, en kiu la mirinda vivo 33 de la malriĉulo de Dio estis al mi rakontita.
**Notes:**
* The speaker is referring to the story of Saint Francis of Assisi, who was known for his poverty and humility. * The "poor man of God" is a common title for Saint Francis. * The "harmonious deities" are the other saints who are gathered in Paradise.

* The speaker is referring to the story of Saint Dominic, who was known for his preaching and his founding of the Dominican Order. * The "threshing" is a metaphor for the work of preaching and converting souls. * The "seed" is a metaphor for the souls that are saved through preaching. * The "other threshing" is a metaphor for the work of preaching to the pagans.
